snippet: A government document cites the right to intercept communications that go through services like Facebook, even if they are between people in Britain.
abstract: British government asserts the right to intercept communications that go through services like Facebook, even if they are between people in Britain; position, described in government document, is broad legal rationale for collecting information from Internet use by its citizens.

byline.contributor: Charlie Savage contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A government document cites the right to intercept communications that go through services like Facebook, even if they are between people in Britain.

headline.main: British Spy Agencies Assert Power to Intercept Web Traffic
headline.print_headline: British Spy Agencies Assert Power to Intercept Web Traffic
